p: The Union of Comoros is located in the South West Indian Ocean at the northern end of the Mozambique Channel and is considered to be a gateway to islands in the Indian Ocean for various infectious agents imported from mainland Africa. Since 2002, live ruminants are imported from Tanzania and have entered the country without a period of quarantine or a clinical examination [18]. Finally, in the past, animal trade has already affected the country health status on several occasions, with regard to many diseases, like blackleg in 1970 and 1995, the contagious ecthyma in 1999, and the East Coast fever in 2003 and 2004 [19]â€“ [21].
